wiki.content: According to the You Oughta Know Songfacts, the song is rumored to be about the actor Dave Coulier, who Morissette went out with for a while when she was 16 and he was 31 In a 2008 interview with the Calgary Herald, Coulier claimed that this song was about their rocky former relationship User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: According to the You Oughta Know Songfacts, the song is rumored to be about the actor Dave Coulier, who Morissette went out with for a while when she was 16 and he was 31 In a 2008 interview with the Calgary Herald, Coulier claimed that this song was about their rocky former relationship

track.name: You Oughta Know
comments: someone needs to break her heart again so she'll come up with some new good shit like this [3]
someone needs to break her heart again so she'll come up with some new good shit like this [2]

...  love everyone  ...
and all of gods creation ( s ) .!
as you would love  ...  god  himself .!
By the way, Coulier thinking the song's about him and putting it on blast for the whole world is just proof of his ego.  This song means so much more than that.
I'm not gonna fade as soon as you close your eyes, and you know it.
I froze in my tracks the first time I heard this track....those lyrics are sooo powerful....we've all had our heart broken and felt the exact same way!
Alanis...I LOVE it when you talk dirty.  And angry...why not? Who else does lyrics like these?
This song is so angry and crazy.... and I still LOVE IT!!!!!
Best moment of my life, riding in a car with my ex-girlfriend and hearing her sing along to this song perfectly.
And I'm here to remind you, of the mess you left when you went away, it's not fair to deny me, of the cross I bear that you gave to me, you, you, you oughta know. <3
someone needs to break her heart again so she'll come up with some new good shit like this
